title: GUIDE TO TRACTOR PALLET FORKS.  WHAT SIZE PALLET FORKS?

tasks.task: Selecting the right pallet fork for a tractor and understanding quick attach types.
subtasks: Identifying the correct quick attach type (John Deere Quick Attch or Skid Steer Quick Attch) for the tractor make and model.
Ensuring proper pin placement for secure attachment.
Aligning the tines onto the tractor frame and understanding slot positioning.
Adjusting the fork position using the quick attach mechanism.
Comparing different weight capacity forks (e.g., 900 lb, 2000 lb, 4200 lb, 5500 lb) and their appropriate use cases.
Considering safety and counterweight options (e.g., ballast weights, hitch hangers).
Understanding the importance of proper load center distance.
Selecting the appropriate tine length based on the application.
Demonstrating fork extensions for increased reach.
Discussing the variety of uses for pallet forks beyond pallet lifting (e.g., moving logs, brush piles, hay bales).
Addressing the consideration of clamp-on forks and their limitations.
Highlighting safety practices when using pallet forks with tractors.
